abstract.p: Netpliance reduces price of its i-opener device by $100, to $299 (S)

block.p: The maker of one of the industry's first so-called Internet appliances -- small computers configured just for using the Web and e-mail -- Netpliance, has reduced the price of its i-opener device by $100, to $299. The i-opener 2001 Membership Program includes a monitor, separate keyboard and custom features like a stock tracking program and four e-mail accounts. Customers must also pay $21.95 monthly for Internet access through the company. A few months ago, the company discontinued a $99 introductory price and raised its cost to $399. Customers who paid the higher price can get a $100 credit, the company said.
